info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:25PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Montezuma and west central La Plata Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1024 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mancos, or 25 miles west of Durango, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also expected with this storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mancos. This includes U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 49 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
